other_tests.findings: Initial ECG was reportedly normal; repeat ECG showed ST-segment elevations in the inferior and apical leads.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Progression from normal to ST-segment elevations within 24 hours.

other_tests.findings: Normal epicardial coronary arteries; TIMI grade 2 flow; moderate systolic dysfunction with LV ejection fraction of 40%; midanterior wall and apical wall hypokinesis and inferior wall akinesis.
Demonstrated an ejection fraction of 30% with multiple wall motion abnormalities, most notable inferiorly.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Subsequent echocardiogram showed severe systolic dysfunction with LV ejection fraction of 15%-20%.

other_tests.findings: Focally confluent areas of myocyte necrosis consistent with ischemic microvascular injury; microthrombi in arterioles.
Severe biventricular dysfunction, diffuse myocardial edema, and microvascular obstruction; no LV thrombus.
Right atrium at 12 mm Hg; right ventricle at 45/12 mm Hg; pulmonary artery at 46/30/37 mm Hg; pulmonary capillary wedge pressure at 27 mm Hg.
